TEXT.TITLE: LYNG SAYS TOO LATE FOR CROP DECOUPLING THIS YEAR
TEXT.BODY: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng said it is too late to implement a full 0/92 acreage provision, or "decoupling," for 1987 grain crops. "I think there's a chance we'll see that legislation (0/92) passed, (but) not for 1987 crops. It's too late," Lyng told the National Grain and Feed Association convention here. Lyng added that there seems some support in Congress for 0/92 and there was a good chance a pilot 0/92 program will be passed as part of a pending disaster bill. But he indicated that it is already too late in the year to alter the 1987 crop program. Sign-up for spring crops closes the end of this month. Overall, Lyng predicted very little change will be legislated in the 1985 farm bill this year. Reuter
